image.altText: Robert Ovadia wearing a suit with a tie

props.synopsis: The veteran journalist had taken his former employer to the Federal Court after an internal investigation into allegations of "inappropriate behaviour" that led to his sacking in June.

title.children: Sacked journalist Robert Ovadia drops case against Seven Network for 'personal reasons'

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and dressed in a suit speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: It began with an argument between Coalition colleagues, Wes Fang and Natalie Ward, an ended with Mr Fang taking a swipe at the Liberal leader before being removed from a hearing in NSW parliament.

title.children: MP booted from parliamentary hearing after bickering with Coalition colleague

image.altText: A man walking down a street wearing a black t shirt

props.synopsis: George Alex was supposed to appear in court today after being found guilty over a $10 million ATO fraud but he is instead in rehab being treated for an opioid addiction.

title.children: Sydney construction boss in custody after failing to attend court over $10m scam

image.altText: Rainbow Flag

props.synopsis: The 2026 census questions on gender and sexual orientation that have been at the centre of a political brawl for the past week have been revealed to the ABC.

title.children: LGBTQI+ questions scrapped from census revealed

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman signs a document while sitting on a park bench next to a man.

props.synopsis: The federal government will pay up to $202 million to settle a historic stolen wages class action in the Northern Territory involving thousands of Indigenous workers and their relatives.

title.children: Commonwealth to pay up to $202m settlement in NT Indigenous stolen wages class action

image.altText: Ben Hance celebrates breaking his world record at Paris Paralympics.

props.synopsis: Australia's Ben Hance makes a statement during the defence of his Paralympic title in the men's 100m backstroke S14 event after breaking his world record in the heats. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie Hance breaks world record as he looks to defend Paralympic gold in Paris

image.altText: Ed Richards kicks the ball while being tackled

props.synopsis: It's do or die for the Western Bulldogs and Hawthorn, as two of the AFL's hottest teams meet at the MCG with a semifinal spot up for grabs. Follow live.

title.children: Bulldogs and Hawks face off in high-octane elimination final at the MCG

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: QT: Dogs take a two-goal lead into the first change
Where the game might be won
Bulldogs held goalless as Power win AFLW clash

image.altText: Mark Nawaqanitawase leaps to catch the ball

props.synopsis: The Rabbitohs look to ruin the Roosters run into the finals in the latest edition of their long-seated rivalry. Earlier, the Eels avoided the wooden spoon by thrashing Wests Tigers. Follow live.

title.children: Former Wallaby scores spectacular debut try as Roosters take on Rabbitohs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Parramatta wins spoon bowl, thrashing Wests Tigers
Half time: Eels on top in the Spoon Bowl

image.altText: tourists taking pictures of kangaroo

props.synopsis: Dozens of kangaroos have set up home in a residential area south of Newcastle, attracting a wave of tourists and prompting warnings about potential attacks.

title.children: Fears of attacks as unruly roos take over coastal NSW community

image.altText: Toddler in jumpsuit

props.synopsis: Jordan Thompson died with a toxic amount of an antidepressant in his system, which the Crown alleges his mother's then-partner put in in his drink. The accused denies the allegation.

title.children: Jury hears man accused of killing toddler had chance to put antidepressants in chocolate milk

image.altText: Two people are shown in silhouette on a balcony in a nightclub bathed in purple light.

props.synopsis: Two New South Wales government agencies are assessing allegations that leading hospitality group Merivale condoned drug use at its venues, failed to adequately respond to claims of sexual assault and screened at an awards night uncensored CCTV footage of people having sex.

title.children: Merivale hospitality group in the spotlight as agencies assess allegations from ABC investigation

image.altText: A painted wood building is seen through smoke; sitting charred in the mud, behind yellow tape.

props.synopsis: A fire in a primary school dormitory in Kenya has killed 17 students and seriously burned 16 others.

title.children: 'Horrific' fire at Kenyan primary boarding school kills 17 students

image.altText: A group of people in Sudan, sitting down, outside with all their belongings around them.

props.synopsis: The human rights experts urge the creation of an "independent and impartial force" to help civilians in the war-torn country.

title.children: UN-backed human rights experts call for 'independent force' to war-torn Sudan

image.altText: two women laughing as they take a selfie outdoors at the 2023 bluesfest music festival in byron bay

props.synopsis: A report commissioned by organisers of the Byron Bay festival paints a picture of what the region stands to lose without the event, which is set to wrap up next year.

title.children: As the end looms for Bluesfest, data shows the 2024 event pumped $230 million into the NSW economy

image.altText: man with shirt on head

props.synopsis: Nathan Bernhard pleaded not guilty to dangerous and negligent driving charges after he allegedly drove over two men he had been drinking with in May last year.

title.children: Man accused of running over and killing two men while drink-driving to face trial

image.altText: Three antique firearms lie on top of a black case.

props.synopsis: Arrests have been made over the theft of historical handguns worth more than $200,000 from the Lithgow Small Arms Factory Museum.

title.children: Police arrest three arrested over weapons museum theft but 14 handguns still missing

image.altText: A man at a cash register.

props.synopsis: With freight adding up to 50 per cent to their cost of living, Lord Howe Islanders find ways to manage the price of living in paradise.

title.children: The price of living in paradise, where a small jar of coffee is $17, rice is $9 per kilo and petrol's $4 per litre

props.synopsis: The comments come after a week in which Treasurer Jim Chalmers and RBA governor Michele Bullock downplayed suggestions of a rift.

title.children: PM affirms 'respect' for Reserve Bank after Wayne Swan likens interest rate strategy to a punch in the face

image.altText: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris speak into microphones in two side-by-side images.

props.synopsis: After plenty of haggling, the Donald Trump and Kamala Harris camps have agreed to some rules for the first presidential debate. But neither side is entirely happy.

title.children: The Trump-Harris debate rules have been released, and both sides are complaining

image.altText: A woman in a black barrister's gown and wig.

props.synopsis: Fiji's anti-corruption commission has been engulfed in an extraordinary saga after its new chief was detained and questioned by police on the orders of her second-in-command.

title.children: Fiji's new anti-corruption chief detained, a day after her appointment

image.altText: Two women, one aged about 40 and the other one older, leave a building.

props.synopsis: Lauren Austin, 39, appears in Fremantle Magistrates Court charged with sexual offences against a teenager under her supervision.

title.children: Australian hockey coach banned from supervising children as bail condition on child sex charges

image.altText: Cheese on a wooden board in the sunlight.

props.synopsis: Why has King Island Island Dairy, a brand with over 120 years of history, failed? Was it, as one local cheesemaker says, due to "a downward trajectory based on a flawed model"? Is a multi-national to blame? One thing is for sure: the local community just want to know what is next.

title.children: Many Australians love King Island Dairy cheese, so why did it fail?

image.altText: Two female police officers walking with a woman under arrest

props.synopsis: Four-year-old Willow Dunn was just 6.5 kilograms when she died and had deep pressure sores and a severe lice infestation.

title.children: Stepmother sentenced over 'gross neglect' and 'abandonment' of 4yo stepdaughter with Down syndrome

image.altText: A little girl with a pink cap, smiling

props.synopsis: Multiple members of a religious group charged over the death of eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs have told a court she will be resurrected and will rise again more than two years after her death.

title.children: 'Elizabeth is sleeping': Father accused of daughter's murder tells court he believes she will be resurrected

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: National cabinet has agreed to a $4.7 billion plan to ramp up frontline legal support for people escaping family violence.

title.children: National cabinet promises $4.7 billion plan for frontline family violence services

image.altText: A man with large glasses smiles gently in front of a city skyline

props.synopsis: Sydney has "very few" councillors with disabilities, but Daniel McDonald wants to change that at this upcoming local election.

title.children: Artist vies to become one of Sydney's first councillors living with deafness

image.altText: Remi Kamo

props.synopsis: Remi Kamo hits out at the Queensland Firebirds over claims of a toxic culture, as Netball Australia investigates the inner workings of the troubled club.

title.children: 'I wouldn't go back': Axed Firebird hits out at club amid claims of a toxic culture

image.altText: police gather on a sporting girl

props.synopsis: As authorities investigate a hammer-throwing incident which critically injured a 13-year-old boy at a suburban Adelaide athletics ground, police say the "tragic" situation appears to have been the result of an "incredibly unfortunate accident".

title.children: Teenage hammer-throwing victim 'fighting for his life' after 'tragic' accident at suburban sports ground

image.altText: Melissa Tapper prepares to serve at the Paris Olympics

props.synopsis: Several Paralympic athletes over the years have competed in both the Olympics and Paralympic Games, but what does this mean for the value of the Paralympic movement?

title.children: Being able to compete at both the Olympics and Paralympics is a rare feat. But does it damage the Paralympic movement?

image.altText: Patchy snow slope with mounds of dirt dotted through it

props.synopsis: Tourism operators and the broader Snowy Mountains region are looking to summer tourism options as they face the prospect of warmer winters and shorter ski seasons.

title.children: This year's ski season ended far earlier than usual, prompting soul-searching among operators

image.altText: A woman hold a photo of her son.

props.synopsis: The governor-general will soon receive the final report of the Royal Commission into Defence and Veterans Suicide. Grieving families are hoping it will lead to lasting change.

title.children: '3,000 veterans dead': This grieving mother has led the fight for all of them

image.altText: Man smiles in wheelchair looking up at basketball ring.

props.synopsis: Gold medallist Gerry Hewson has established five regional wheelchair basketball clubs this year and has plans for eight more. It's all part of his plan to set Australia up for glory before the Brisbane Paralympics in 2032.

title.children: Four-time Paralympian shuns the big smoke in hunt for next wave of wheelchair basketball stars

image.altText: Two men celebrate winning a tennis match

props.synopsis: A major payday and a chance at glory will be on the line for Jordan Thompson and Max Purcell after they powered through to the US Open doubles final after victory over American pair Nathaniel Lammons and Jackson Withrow.

title.children: Aussie duo Jordan Thompson and Max Purcell edge closer to major redemption after making US Open final

image.altText: An older woman with a brown bob wearing round sunglasses speaks into multiple microphones looking sad

props.synopsis: Gisele Picot is calm and composed as she recounts the moment she realised her husband of 50 years had repeatedly drugged her and invited strangers to sexually assault her in their home.

title.children: Victim recounts 'scenes of horror' as French trial is told husband drugged and raped her for a decade

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks into court.

props.synopsis: The former Liberal staffer has been given extra time to file amended grounds of appeal, as he seeks to overturn the result of his failed defamation case.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer defends missed deadlines in attempt to overturn defamation ruling
